required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Photon/Proton Radiation Therapy for Carcinoma of the Nasopharynx
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Outcomes Protocol of Photon/Proton Beam Radiation Therapy for Carcinoma of the Nasopharynx

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to collect outcomes information to see what effects photon/proton beam radiation has on nasopharynx cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: Data collection will be obtained from the patient's medical records including initial evaluation, pathology report, dosimetry information, radiotherapy completion records and follow-up.

primary_outcome.time_frame: After radiation therapy, every 4 months for at least 10 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Collect and analyze tumor control outcomes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months and 24 months after radiation therapy then annually for 10 years

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated at radiaton oncology clinic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
* Nasopharynx cancer.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of distant metastasis.
- Previous radiation for head and neck cancer.

overall_official.affiliation: University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute

facility.name: University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute

link.description: Contact the University of Florida Proton Therapy Institute
